e. e. cummings.gloss: United States writer noted for his typographically eccentric poetry (1894-1962)

ee.gloss: the branch of engineering science that studies the uses of electricity and the equipment for power generation and distribution and the control of machines and communication

eec.gloss: an international organization of European countries formed after World War II to reduce trade barriers and increase cooperation among its members

eeg.gloss: a graphical record of electrical activity of the brain

eelam.gloss: the independent state that the Tamil Tigers have fought for

eelgrass.gloss: submerged marine plant with very long narrow leaves found in abundance along North Atlantic coasts
submerged aquatic plant with ribbonlike leaves

eelgrass family.gloss: used in some classifications: essentially equivalent to Potamogetonaceae

eelpout.gloss: marine eellike mostly bottom-dwelling fishes of northern seas
elongate freshwater cod of northern Europe and Asia and North America having barbels around its mouth

eeriness.gloss: strangeness by virtue of being mysterious and inspiring fear
